text: The George Meany-Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award is an award offered annually by AFL–CIO, and bears the name of the first two presidents of the entity. The award recognizes people and entities that fight for human rights in the field of labor relations. == Grantees == * 2000 – Luis Eduardo Garzon * 2001 – U Maung Maung * 2002 – Nancy Riche * 2003 – Wellington Chibebe * 2004 – Mikhail Volynets2004 George Meany–Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award—Mikhail Volynets, President of the Confederation of Free Trade Unions of Ukraine. AFL-CIO * 2005 – Ela Bhatt * 2006 – International Federation of Journalists * 2007 – Firestone Agricultural Workers Union of Liberia * 2008 – Yessika Hoyos * 2009 – Workers Movement of EgyptThe 2009 George Meany-Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award. AFL-CIO * 2011 – Napoleón Gómez UrrutiaNapoleón Gómez Urrutia, Nomination for Meany-Kirkland Award 2011. AFL-CIO * 2012 – Arab Spring workers2012 George Meany – Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award: Labor in the Arab Uprisings. AFL-CIO * 2013 – International Domestic Workers Network2013 George Meany-Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award. AFL-CIO * 2014 – Building and Wood Workers’ InternationalBuilding and Wood Workers win 2014 Meany-Kirkland Award. Solidarity Center * 2015 – Trade Union Confederation of SwazilandAFL-CIO awards TUCOSWA Human Rights Award. IndustriALL * 2016 – Maina Kiai2016 George Meany-Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award. AFL-CIO * 2017 – Han Sang-gyun2017 George Meany-Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award. AFL-CIO * 2018 – National Temporary Protected Status AllianceMeany-Kirkland Human Rights Award-Winner Announced. DC Labor * 2019 – LulaPreso político, Lula ganha prêmio de direitos humanos da principal central sindical do EUA e Canadá. Revista Forum, March 14, 2019 == References == == External links == *George Meany-Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award Category:Human rights awards Category:Humanitarian and service awards
title: George Meany-Lane Kirkland Human Rights Award
